comments.body:
After reviewing how this is used (ref:https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/79238#pullrequestreview-254347384) 

I think it's correct and intentional that this uses `os.Args`; maybe add a comment explaining as much?  Or something like change `main` to not take `args`?

Yep, that is correct, and I will add a comment why it is so.

Basically, the parameter ``args`` is given by Cobra, and I cannot change that, it won't be compilable. Basically, ``args`` will contain the subcommand's arguments (``./agnhost subcommand args here``), while the tests are also verifying the entrypoint name (``os.Args[0]``) (there are tests which are overriding the entrypoint).
